title: @Meddler @Balanceteam Are you content with where Azir is at?
body: I wouldn't say I am the best Azir player by any means,but I clocked enough games on all my accounts to understand all the important quirks and mechanics to the champion.After the most recent nerfs I had about 250 or so odd games,tried to play another 25 and became frustrated at just how little impact Azir has pre-16.Not to mention how already difficult lane match ups like Leblanc turn into "how many times can I die before 10".I've personally had to put him down as Azir just isn't good,there are other people who do his job better as a late game siege mage,he has no burst,lackluster CC and useless mobility concerning the two previous points.I understand that if Azir is allowed too much power he overtakes the mid lane,but in his current iteration he is gutter trash.

replies.body: No, we're not happy with Azir's current state. Still figuring out exactly what response to it we want to take though (just balance changes? mini rework? mixture of the two? a larger rework? etc).

Meddler please :(

I've maimed him since release and have had a consistent 60-70% win rate out of hundreds of games. Don't kill him, his kit is perfect. Let the mets settle down more before smacking him with the bat.

In case it's unclear one of the big things we're unhappy with about Azir is present is that, for most players, he's too weak. We've put him there because of how oppressive he can be when he's strong, we don't want him to be as weak a choice as he currently is for the average Azir player long term though.

What do you consider about removing the dash? It seems to be the most popular change for every poll.

Yes, it reduces "cool factor" of LCS plays, but it reduces his safety as well as fitting thematically (commanding soldiers from a distance, Azir's not the type to fight next to them), which would allow for buffs elsewhere?

I think the dash itself is good, the Emperor retreating makes sense.

The damage and collision shield make no sense though and removing his offensive cappabilities there is a nice start.

Maybe make it so that his soldiers dash with him and surround him in a circle.

I understand you point, Meddler, but one of the aspects of Azir is that complexity. If he resonates with a player, they put in the time to master him, and learn him. He is a raged hyper carry with.a huge skill ceiling, and the challenge, that every game you can always improve, is one of the best parts of him. He is incredibly fun, the only champion I can never be bored with no matter how much I play him, and every game feels rewarding. If you change him, it would take a scalpel honed to a incredibly sharp edge to keep his hard to master hypercarry shuffling identity intact. Don't take out what makes him a complex and fun champion. 

Also, with respect, the most recent Azir nerf, the one that appears to have driven more casual Azir players to the current meta midlands, may not have been necessary. After the second to most recent change, the mets was shifting significantly as a whole, and as it settled he may have not needed it. To be fair I hardly even noticed it, don't even remember what it was, but for players with less experience, they either switched to the current OP, or just went back to their comfort champ. He may have been fine. I wold love to descuss basically any aspect of his kit and any change you are considering. If you do end up deciding to change him, please make some sort of discussion so players like me, and anyone who knows him, can at least try to contribute and make a case for/against something. Sorry for the text wall but this is something I feel very strongly about. Il attach my classroom doodle of the emperor in all his pencil drawn glory if you promise not to kill him :D

Long live the emperor, don't kill him and make Sivir do the work reviving him again.

Can't you hit temporal aspects of his kit (inc. speed) to hit the high end more than the low end? They skilled end is presumably much more determined by reflexes and speed, so if you nerf that doesn/t it allow you to buff him in areas the lower end will appreciate more?

I just want to voice my support for the idea of a mini-rework. As it is Azir is basically always weak in the hands of the average player, but has to be like that because he's so frustratingly oppressive when the Azir player actually knows what they're doing.

Personally I'd second the idea of removing his dash: as much as the shurima shuffle is part of his thing, that level of mobility really doesn't seem like a good idea on what is essentially a strange form of siege mage. There's a reason champions like Lux and Xerath are immobile.

We've put him there because of how oppressive he can be when he's strong, we don't want him to be as weak a choice as he currently is for the average Azir player long term though.

It's fine to have high skill-floor champs but Azir is too weak for everyone (including pros). He's even worse than the current AP Kog.

Well there's a simple fix that can be implemented for future champion releases:

Don't bog them down with way too much extraneous power!
I cannot remember the last champion release (brand new champion, not rework just to clarify) that wasn't full to the brim with too much stuff to occupy not just one kit, but a kit and a half, at a stretch a kit and 3/4.

Your Champions have lots of cool ideas in them, but a little bit of restraint can go miles to help with making new champions less of a cold sweat nightmare to balance.

Need evidence to this? Well, just look at the last 6-7 or so champions to be released and think about how many nerfs they've had to get.

What kind of changes are you planning to give to Azir? Are they similar to the changes that RiotGypsy said a month ago on Reddit? Personally I wouldn't like it either way if his range was nerfed or his Shurima shuffle was removed from his kit since they are the parts that make Azir unique.

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4tf4jl/lets_talk_azir/

In all honesty, Azir's kit is mainly excruciatingly good because of it's versatility. 

I think the best way to tone him down a bit is removing the ability to cast Q while E is underway, so the potential for plays are still there but are a lot more riskier and take more effort, besides Azir already can do good work from afar, keeping the dash + ult combo would be a suitable skill ceiling for Azir. You can even add a short channel before E procs if it's still such a problem. His E is used for re-positioning himself in a teamfight mostly.

I think his difficulty curve is one of the things that attracted me to him, along with his theme.  It would definitely be a plus for him to be easier to learn, but I feel the primary focus should be on attempting to remove some of his extraneous/unfitting strengths (high mobility/capability to engage a fight with E -> Q -> R) and then focusing and reinforcing his intended strengths.  

He already has weaknesses in the form of being very squishy and lacking sustain while having strengths such as strong pushing, teamfight DPS, decent poke, and safety.  Focus on giving him more distinct strengths and weaknesses.

The problem is that last nerf (6.14 patch) makes him literally a trash, both in solo q and competetive play. It's really frustrating when you spend a lot of time on mastering champion (Azir in this case), you enjoy playing him and then it's totally overnerfed and not worth to play for already 2 months. I understand that in the long term Azir needs changes, but for now you could at least buff a little the curve of his W dmg scaling which was nerfed in 6.14 (I don't except to bring him back to 6.13 state but just make him playable for the real Azir enthusiasts).

Hey Meddler,
Does this line of thinking also applies to other hard-to-master champs that are balanced for high play? (Ex. Yasuo.)

Have you considered removing the dash? It has always been weird and out of place both thematically and gameplay. Even if it has its cool parts, it just doesn't work on a champion that already has one of the most terrifying ultimates in the game. I think the shield is fine though.

may be you should give azir his knock up on his E back So we at least have Solo kill potential in lane that in itself would be healthy since its almost nearly impossible to kill someone in lane we have to wait till mid to late game for team fights

All I ask and I'm sure there are many that agree, Don't take away the shuffle. I love azir's kit the way it is, the shurima shuffle is his idientity. I know there are number/stat related changes that can really help him right now but please don't remove shuffle.

Hey Meddler,

I made this thread a few days ago.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/KAFhsddF-riot-meddler-what-is-your-view-on-gangplanks-interaction-with-crit-chance-and-bandit-abuse

I don't know if you didn't see it, or if you decided not to comment about it, but I'd like to just quickly drop the link here incase it was the first option :P

please do a real rework, his current standing as a long-range hypercarry with solid burst, absurd utility, a long-range engage and one of the strongest laning phases in the game all at once is just nothing that could ever be balanced. Either keep his range and dmg but cut down his mobility to zero, or cut his range, some dmg and make him more durable.
Have you thought about giving his soldiers health so we have the chance to hit them as he tries to force us out of lane?

This would remove his strength and make his another stereotypical minion caster. His soldier's are perfectly fine the way they are atm. They require direct input and requires the Azir to watch over them AND himself to be efficient. Azir already has significant problems with Attack speed early in-game to avoid over-poke.
Well why not just revert the champion if he is that much of a problem just like kogmaw.
He's fine now. People can actually do stuff against him now

People could always do stuff against him. Only the best of the best Azir can maximize safety through positioning and you can stop his dash if you co-ordinate with a tank to block it. I do argue having a Q ad an addon on his E dash is WAY too much. Honestly just remove that feature or make it that Q doesn't deal anymore damage when Azir is following it.

> I understand that if Azir is allowed too much power he overtakes the mid lane,but in his current iteration he is gutter trash.

He got Yoricked, and for good reason. Please stop bitching about it and patiently wait for a rework.
I honestly feel that the thing that makes him so suppressible is his ult, it's too game-changing. I honestly would want his ult to be changed instead.
